title: Developing Differentiated Instruction Skills for Elementary Teachers: A 4C/ID Model-Based Job Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Establishes collaborative learning environments using digital devices, incorporating simulations and case analyses reflecting real classroom scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can independently design differentiated instruction by applying the four components of the 4C/ID model (learning tasks, supportive information, procedural information, part-task practice)
Learners can develop and implement at least three differentiated instructional strategies to address diverse learning needs in mathematics classes
Learners can provide instructional design feedback through collaboration with peer teachers and improve at least two types of instructional materials by reflecting on formative assessment results

resources: Mathematics lesson videos and case database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
